title: How to Make and Embroider Reusable Shopping Bags

steps.headline: Choose your favorite fabric.
steps.description: Cut two pieces of fabric to the size slightly larger than you want your bag to be.

steps.headline: Place the pieces of fabric together.
steps.description: The right sides should be facing each other.

steps.headline: Sew the two pieces together along three sides.
steps.description: Leave the top of the bag unsewn.

steps.headline: Turn the top edge over and sew the edge down.
steps.description: Make sure you don't sew the two sides of your bag together.

steps.headline: Cut two long strips of fabric for the handles.
steps.description: These strips should be a little more than twice as long and twice as wide as you would like your handles to be.

steps.headline: Fold one strip in half, lengthwise with the right sides facing each other.
Sew along the edge to create a tube.
Use a knitting needle (or something similar) to turn your tube right side out.
Repeat the above steps to create the other handle.
Attach the handles to the (still inside out) bag body.
steps.description: Attach the handles with pins first to make sure they are where you want them to be.

steps.headline: Stitch the handles in place.
Turn the bag right side out.
Assemble the materials you will need.
steps.description: These are shown in the photo above

steps.headline: Draw the leaves.
steps.description: Cut out a leaf and flower as the picture shows. Place the leaf on the bag; draw the leaf shape on the fabric one by one.

steps.headline: Embroider the leaves.
steps.description: Embroider the leaf with different colored threads along the edges of the leaves.

steps.headline: Embroider the diagonal for each leaf.
Place the paper flower on the gap between two leaves
Draw the flower shape on the fabric.
steps.description: Draw the other flowers in the gaps.

steps.headline: Embroider the flowers.
steps.description: Embroider the flowers with different colors.

steps.headline: Embroider as many leaves and flowers as you like.

text: Make the Bag Choose your favorite fabric. Cut two pieces of fabric to the size slightly larger than you want your bag to be. Place the pieces of fabric together. The right sides should be facing each other. Sew the two pieces together along three sides. Leave the top of the bag unsewn. Turn the top edge over and sew the edge down. Make sure you don't sew the two sides of your bag together. Cut two long strips of fabric for the handles. These strips should be a little more than twice as long and twice as wide as you would like your handles to be. Fold one strip in half, lengthwise with the right sides facing each other.  Sew along the edge to create a tube.  Use a knitting needle (or something similar) to turn your tube right side out.  Repeat the above steps to create the other handle.  Attach the handles to the (still inside out) bag body. Attach the handles with pins first to make sure they are where you want them to be. Stitch the handles in place.  Turn the bag right side out.  Embroider the Leaves Assemble the materials you will need. These are shown in the photo above Draw the leaves. Cut out a leaf and flower as the picture shows. Place the leaf on the bag; draw the leaf shape on the fabric one by one. Embroider the leaves. Embroider the leaf with different colored threads along the edges of the leaves. Embroider the diagonal for each leaf.  Embroider the Flowers Place the paper flower on the gap between two leaves  Draw the flower shape on the fabric. Draw the other flowers in the gaps. Embroider the flowers. Embroider the flowers with different colors. Embroider as many leaves and flowers as you like.
